name: HCLAppScanOnCloud
description: Perform static, dynamic, mobile and open source security tests for your applications in AppScan on Cloud.
author: HCLTechnologies
instanceNameFormat: Run HCL AppScan on Cloud Security Test

inputs.name: AppSecTestService
inputs.label: Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the credentials to use for running a scan. Add credentials using the HCL AppScan on Cloud Service. How do I get my credentials?

inputs.name: applications
inputs.label: Application
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application that this scan will be associated with. If the list is empty ensure that you have a valid selection in the Credentials field.

inputs.name: scanname
inputs.label: Scan Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: An optional name for the scan. This name is used to differentiate results on the Build page.

inputs.name: scantype
inputs.label: Scan Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: The type of test to run.

inputs.name: scanloc
inputs.label: Repository Subdirectory To Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Limits the scan to a subdirectory of the repository. Leave this field blank to scan the entire repository.

inputs.name: scanURL
inputs.label: Starting URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL where the scan will start exploring the site.

inputs.name: appFile
inputs.label: Application File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The .apk or .ipa file to be scanned.

inputs.name: OpenSourceScanOnly
inputs.label: Open source only
inputs.helpMarkDown: To run static analysis with the open source only option, the user must have open source only enabled in the cloud subscription.

inputs.name: ScanSpeedOptions
inputs.label: Select Scan Speed

options.simple: Simple - A simple scan performs a surface-level analysis of your files to identify the most pressing issues for remediation. It takes the least amount of time to complete.
options.balanced: Balanced - A balanced scan provides a medium level of detail on the analysis and identification of security issues, and takes a bit more time to complete than the 'Simple' scan.
options.deep: Deep - A deep scan performs a more complete analysis of your files to identify vulnerabilities, and usually takes longer to complete
options.thorough: Thorough - A thorough scan performs a comprehensive analysis to identify the most comprehensive list of vulnerabilities and will take the longest time to complete.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Options to determine the scan speed

inputs.name: type
inputs.label: Site Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Defines whether the site is Staging or Production.

inputs.name: optimization
inputs.label: Test Optimization
inputs.helpMarkDown:
You can reduce scan time by choosing a balance between speed and issue coverage. Optimized scans omit tests defined in the Test policy for less severe or less likely vulnerabilities, based on ongoing statistical analyses. [Read more about test optimization](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/dast_test_optimization.html) 

 Note: The actual reduction in time, and extent of issue coverage, will vary depending on your application.

inputs.name: dynamicuser
inputs.label: Login User
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a valid username for HCL AppScan on Cloud to use to log in when scanning your app.

inputs.name: dynamicloginpassword
inputs.label: Login Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the password for the provided username. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: dynamicextra
inputs.label: Third Credential
inputs.helpMarkDown: If your application login process requires a third credential, add it here..

inputs.name: dynamicpresence
inputs.label: Presence
inputs.helpMarkDown: For sites not available on the internet, provide the ID of the AppScan Presence that can be used for the scan.

inputs.name: scanfile
inputs.label: Scan File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to a scan template file (.scan or .scant)

inputs.name: mobileuser
inputs.label: Login User
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a valid username for HCL AppScan on Cloud to use to log in when scanning your app.

inputs.name: mobileloginpassword
inputs.label: Login Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the password for the provided username. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: mobileextra
inputs.label: Third Credential
inputs.helpMarkDown: If your application login process requires a third credential, add it here..

inputs.name: mobilepresence
inputs.label: Presence
inputs.helpMarkDown: For sites not available on the internet, provide the ID of the AppScan Presence that can be used for the scan.

inputs.name: email
inputs.label: Email Notification
inputs.helpMarkDown: Send the user an email when analysis is complete.

inputs.name: personalScan
inputs.label: Run as a personal scan
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Personal scan

A personal scan does not affect the application data and compliance until it is promoted. If not promoted it is deleted after 30 days.

[Learn more](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/ASoC/appseccloud_scans_personal.html)

inputs.name: suspend
inputs.label: Suspend job until security analysis completes
inputs.helpMarkDown: When selected, scan report and summary are available in Azure. Otherwise, download the report from HCL AppScan on Cloud portal.

inputs.name: FailBuildConfiguration
inputs.label: Fail Build Configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the conditions that will cause the build to fail based on the results of the security scan.

inputs.name: FailBuildChoice
inputs.label: Choose One:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build either based on a set of conditions or if one or more issues are found which are non compliant with respect to the selected application's policies.

inputs.name: buildfailTotal
inputs.label: Total
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the total number of security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionTotal
inputs.label: Security Issues greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for total count of issues

inputs.name: buildfailHigh
inputs.label: High
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the number of High severity security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionHigh
inputs.label: Security Issues greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for high count of issues

inputs.name: buildfailMedium
inputs.label: Medium
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the number of Medium severity security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionMedium
inputs.label: Security Issues greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for medium count of issues

inputs.name: buildfailLow
inputs.label: Low
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the number of Low severity security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionLow
inputs.label: Security Issues is greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for low count of issues
